heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 11 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 435 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 155.5m higher than yesterday, 63.8m lower than the past week, 435.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 866m to a maximum of 3020m, averaging 1872.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1936.6m and 2310m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
